The bar had a very helpful lady bar tender but the bar closes i think by 10 pm. The location is not too bad since there are lot of bus and tram stops everywhere but we choose to use the taxis. Very nice home made gelato shop right next the hotel. There is no 24 hours room service. The restaurant is only open for breakfast. The hotel staff are very willing to arrange for taxis wherever you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - much better than I even expected”
Reviews.Author: lineofsight
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel through the hotel website (group of 6). I also booked transfers through the hotel website. The transfer booking was a bit confusing as the website asked us to contact the hotel with flight information once the online transaction was complete. On the confirmation e-mail the only contact information was the hotel phone number and a generic "info@" e-mail address. I coordinated through e-mail the transfer details. I learned that the transfer is not actually charged when you reserve the rooms, but is billed on checkout. I can not say enough about how professional and well handled my transfer was, even with an itinerary that changed requiring a change in arrival date. The free hotel breakfast was amazing and far above anything else I have experienced in Europe. No eggs and bacon but meat, cheese, pastries, cakes, cereal, yogurt, fruit, milk, five differnt juices, coffee, expresso, capuchino, tea and Great breakfast service! We gladly left a tip for our breakfast waitress each morning. Hotel front desk personnel speak excellent english and are above and beyond helpful with tourist info, restaurant reservations and recommendations, transportation help, reliable prompt wake up calls and provided all around great service. Rooms were nice, very clean, sheets were pressed, bathrooms had hair dryers and a voltage converter built into the wall (still need an adapter to the standard Europe two prong plug). Soap and shampoo were provided and plenty of high presser hot water. The towel warmer was a nice touch the ladies in our group appreciated. Location is in a nice quiet neighborhood with a few very good restaurants nearby and a gelataria around the corner. A 10 minute walk gets you to the Metro. 15 minute walk to Trevi Fountain (nearest big tourist attraction).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: shazd039
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 10/15 mins walk from the nearest Metro stop but does have a bus stop round the corner which will bring you to the metro. While its not dead centre of everything, its within very easy reach with the excellent transport system. It is worth staying purely for the exceptionally friendly staff who went way out of their way to be friendly and extremely helpful with tourist info/directions etc. They recommended and booked restaurants for us each night, which was wonderful and no question was too much to ask of them. This service to us made our visit twice as enjoyable and we could not fault this hotel and would def. recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in a central, quiet and convenient part of old town Rome”
Reviews.Author: nymphaeus
Reviews.Content: Hotel Londra & Cargill is located in piazza Sallustio, which is a lovely square a short walk (15 mins) away from Termini railway station. In the piazza itself, the ancient half-buried riuns of the "horti sallustiani" (Roman gardens developed by the historian Sallust in the 1st century BC) make a magnificent and a little-understated display, surrounded as they are by parked cars and many apartment buildings. The area is very lively and offers plenty of restaurants. As far as the shops are concerned In this sarea it will be easier to find a dry-cleaner or a electrician than a pair of Gucci shoes ... But this only makes it more interesting and authentic. The hotel is elegant, formal, and very well maintainted, with fairly sized rooms for the Roman standard and classical furniture, fit for a romantic weekend or a business meeting. I nave made it in time to the breakfast room, but was very happy to pick and choose among the many bars located less than a block away from the hotel. At night the area is very quiet and removed from the buzzing noise of scooters and tourists in the more central parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: Fodara
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel just a few days ago. Great location for an affordable price. Staff extremely helpful and polite. Rooms (mine looked a bit like a small apartment with a sofa, a separate room for clothes and huge bathroom) are great. I was on the 1st floor in a room overlooking a garden/terrace therefore no street noise. No problem with internet and also great breakfast. I will go back to Rome for work and surely from now onwards I will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good, although WI FI was an issue.”
Reviews.Author: seivad79
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel for one night at the end of November 2010. From what I experienced it was a pretty good priced hotel. Rooms were clean and warm, Bathroom was nice and the staff were very helpful and polite. Breakfast was not out of this world but what is expected in Rome. The only thing which I didnt agree with was the WI FI access. The website states free Wi Fi through out the Hotel, however as soon as you get into the lift up to the floors I was'nt able to pick up any wi fi options. A small point I know, however if you are relying on Wi fi for the bedroom you will have to re locate to to foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Worldwanderer67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value for Rome. Located not too far away from Via Veneto and handy for Termini without being a "a hotel behind the station" in a safe and quiet location. Despite our early arrival we were shown to our room after a short wait. It was immacculate, fitted with a new marble bathroom and a comfortable bed with crisp linen, of a reasonable but not too big size and nicely decorated with a certain class. Luggage was delivered promptly. A good continental breakfast was served the next morning by very welcoming staff. We left the hotel with the impression that these people were proffessionals who know their job. What else can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the business area of rome”
Reviews.Author: citygirl033
Reviews.Content: a group of 8 have just returned from a trip to rome. hotel was very nice, clean and hotel staff were very friendly. breakfast was sufficient, continental only but plenty of it. Its a 10 minute walk to republicca metro, where you can access all areas. there is a few restuarants in the area, but quiet other than that. we bought the 48 hour hop on/off bus for 20 euro. its a good way to see the sights and to get to know the city. you can get your tickets in the republicca area, you will see the buses there. ours was the red bus, 110. i would recommend a separate tour for the vatican. be careful though, we were conned. we were approached by a tour guide who offered our group 20 euro a head for the tour. they omitted to tell us that it is a further 20 euro into the vatican. we waited about an hour and a half in the very heavy rain as they were getting more people for the tour. we had to go to their office on the way to the vatican to pay the money. if you dont want a tour guide, i would recommend that you go to the vatican at around 15.00 as there are no queues and buy your ticket there for 15 euro. you can but before you go on the vatican website. the restuarants around the vatican are rip-offs. so please avoid. the sistine chapel is not open sundays.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for Quiet Out Of the Way Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CindyRella_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to Borghese and therefore out of the way for most of the must see attractions in Rome. It's situated in a business district, so restaurants within walking distance are not always open at night, but that makes the streets quiet at night. The front desk was cordial, and the breakfast adequate. Rooms were good, and the bathroom was nice. I would not recommend this based only on the location - it is blocks from the nearest Metro and a 15 minute walk from the Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a quiet part of Rome”
Reviews.Author: ifbourg
Reviews.Content: The hotel has modern, big and clean rooms. The staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfast is saitisfying. As ti concerns its location,the hotel is next to the Villa Borghese., about 15-20 minutes walk from the nearest subway station, though there are bus stops nearby. So, it takes place in a quiet, relaxing neighbourhood but it is a bit far from the main attractions of Rome like the Colosseum, the Tiber river or Vatican City

Reviews.Title: “If you find a good deal in their web site, don't hesitate: take it!”
Reviews.Author: FabioColletto
Reviews.Content: I decided to book this hotel directlty from their web site when I found a 3-nights weekend package for about 90 euros per night. I believe it was the best deal I could have done for our stay in Rome. It's a very good hotel with a decent breakfast (included in the price). It's a big hotel used by some airline crews was well, so don't expected to be treated as you were in a family run tiny hotel. Nevertherless, some of the staff was king, they booked the restaurants I asked and gave some brief directions when we asked for. We got a room in the corner, which was really big for europeans standards. The bathroom was also large, including a good bath tube. The location was very good for what we were looking for: in the city center but not in a very touristic area. We took about 10 to 15 minutes walking to the main toutistic attractions and some times to a bus to get back. There are also some good restaurants near by and a excellent "gelateria": Il Caruso!

Reviews.Title: “Great value with breakfast included”
Reviews.Author: Travelers804
Reviews.Content: Londra and Cargill offers comfortable rooms with comlimentary internet for an excellent value. The bathroom is spacious and offers quality bathroom products. We enjoyed a great breakfast buffet with a variety of options and good coffee. The mattress and pillows were very comfortable, but the comforter was thin and a little scratchy. The location is within walking distance of the Spanish Steps, but it is not a short walk (20-25 minutes). The air conditioning worked well, which was a must during the summer. The hotel staff were just okay. Their directions were minimal and they didn't offer additional information. They did their job, but didn't go beyond the basics. The wait staff at breakfast were much more accommodating than the front lobby staff, who at times made us feel that we were inconveniencing them when asking for support with transportation. Overall, we liked our stay at this hotel and would stay again on a return trip to Rome due to the great value.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid in July- the air conditioning is the rooms is useless !!”
Reviews.Author: July2010_16
Reviews.Content: Have literally just returned from a trip. It was our wedding anniversarry. The hotel looked great on the internet and we thought we were getting an excellent deal. We travelled club from London Heathrow so were looking forward to a bit of luxury- we got this all the way, but not at this hotel !! The staff were OK, but don't go out of their way to help. The chap on reception even directed us in the wrong direction to get tickets for the bus to go to the Vatican !! The main thing about this hotel however is the lack of air conditioning in the bedrooms. The temperature in Rome at the moment is about 41 degrees and the air conditioning in the rooms is useless so I would definitely avoid this hotel in the heat. Also, the pictures on the internet are better than the real thing so don't be mislead.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel made our stay in rome unforgettable!!!”
Reviews.Author: nikifotiou
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the people at the reception made our day since they upgraded us to a suite. the hotel is located in a beautiful location , very quiet, with nice buildings (mostly embasies) , beautiful traditional restaurants & cafes just across the road. The hotel is just 15 minutes walking distance from all the major city attractions and via de l corso where all the shopping is very happy with our hotel choice! in the room we also had free WiFi access sooooo ....... we will definetely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location”
Reviews.Author: melbourne237
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite and was not disappointed. Very large room with two large patio windows that opened up onto tiny verandas, but was very welcome in the heat of the day. Very clean hotel and room. No internet connection. The location is very quiet and peaceful and therefore you have quite a walk to get anywhere central. If you want good shopping, don't head for the centre but to the other shopping area some 5 minute walk away in the opposite direction. Its where the locals shop and far better prices. Excellent restaurants there too. An excellent hotel if you want to get away from the crowds and noise but a bit too far from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoFlipflop
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 3/8/2010 -- 3/10/2010. The hotel was perfect for what I wanted to do. It was within walking distance, 20 minutes of the Fontana del Tritone and from there 10 minutes of the Spanish steps and from there 10 minute walk of the Fontana di trevi.The bus line on Del Corso will take you to the collisium for the fare of 1 euro. It is a 5 minute bus ride. Then retrace your steps back to the hotel. You will run into 2 super markets following these routes back to the hotel. small but they will do. 1 1/2 blocks from the hotel on Piave you can catch the bus to Termimi station,it is a 7 minute bus ride.for 1 euro. The best food is in the Tritone square. Hotel was clean and we felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for tourist visit to rome”
Reviews.Author: Stevep5553
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in quiet district very safe and quiet though about 15 min walk to the center ( a bit of a hike), Rooms are however very clean and you can get a very good rate fro the standard of the hotel and buffet breakfast is included. Room are average European size , not frill in the hotel , no dinner restaurant although lots of options nearby to eat. A good base for exploring Rome but you need to be prepared to walk. I would use again if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, nice location - don't eat there, service could be better”
Reviews.Author: LudoPrague
Reviews.Content: Nice location, quiet, rooms are ok. This hotel doesn't have a proper restaurant, they hire catering from external companies and this is not good. We had a group of 70 people and the food was constantly cold + service not good. We also had an issue with the rooms, around 10 of us were put to other hotels as they had a crew from Delta airlines that had not left the hotel. We did our booking weeks in advance and the hnadling of that issue was really poor, some people got upset and the hotel has done nothing as a compensation...really a pity because otherwise, the hotel is ok

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, quiet street”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrvlrStPaul
Reviews.Content: My room was lovely, more spacious than I anticipated, and had a large bathroom. Very clean. Located on a quiet street. It is true that it is quite a hike to walk to attractions, but it's Europe. Put on your walking shoes and just go. Would recommend- nice find.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: P16
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is Fine. Nice walk to most historic locations in Rome. Reception staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. Rooms are a good size, comfortable and kept clean. Breakfast is not great. Limited selection of food to choose from. Otherwise a nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “nice place but not in the city”
Reviews.Author: aysh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Londra and Cargill Hotel between the dates 14-18 Sept. The place was OK. but is not very close to the city, should take a cab or a bus to go to the touristic places. There was a bad odor in room we first checked in. So we asked to change our room. The other room was fine and more spacious. The place is clean but need some repair in some places. The staff is helpful. OVERALL you may try to find some place nicer and closer to the city for the same price, if not that might be a choice...

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean and cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: gpissio
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family from 30th Dec. untill Jan. 3rd. Don't know about the price since we were travelling with a prepaid group trip, but the door price of 300euros seems a little opimistic to me as is the four star grade of the hotel. My complain basically based on the poor breakfast that they offer. Only ceareals,jam,honey and some salami and cheese.They charged me 7 euros for an extra omelet!!! After all Rome is a very expensive city... !!! Anyways the stuff was helpfull and friendly, rooms were very clean and spacious with the bathroom being very well equiptped.The location of the hotel is pretty closed to Via Venetton thus is the Spanish Steps too.It is recommended for travellers and for businessmen.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to the center”
Reviews.Author: chipman75
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel from 30th of December and has just turned last night on the 3th of January. During our stay, the room service,the cleanness of the rooms and the helpfull manner of the guys in the reception was great. We have stayed at the room number 112 and there is no view but you do not go to a holiday to stay at the hotel room. And I can surely tell that it is just 10 min to the Spanish Steps and other central locations by foot. I think you have to try.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gosforth_Ultra
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through venere and for 100 Euros a night it was an excellent deal. Rooms very spacious and nice (could have done with a bit of a more effective AC mind you!) and we found reception staff friendly enough. It's a little out of the way, but not as far as it looked on the maps - maybe a 30 minute walk to the Trevi/Pantheon? Breakfast good, all in all I'd recommend it. As another tip, there is a FANTASTIC little restaurant on the Piazza Sallustio. I don't remeber it's name but it is owned by an ex-jockey and there is a picture of a horse in the window (!!). The food and atmosphere was magnificent and very affordable - seek it out!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Londra Hotel Rome”
Reviews.Author: Vales
Reviews.Content: We loved this Hotel It is in a safe and quite area The reception staff were excellent, very friendly and knowledgeable The breakfast buffet was good Juice, Cereal, Fruit, Breads, Ham and Cheese etc The rooms were nicely decorated fresh and clean and the bathrooms a good size for Rome modern and clean We stayed on the 5th floor They have a bar in the lobby and have a light menu available There is shopping near-by, a branch of Rinacentre there is a good Alimentari Wine /Meat, a Veg/Fruit shop and a fantastic Cheese Shop around the corner(ideal for a summer pick-nics) The hotel is within walking distance of the Galleria Borghese/Villa Borghese There is a small number of nice local restaurants, *Restaurant della Mairoi Via G. Carducci* packed with local office workers at lunch time, not much to look at but oh! the food, look for the review from the Times on the Wall or ask for advice at reception as there is one very close to the hotel that is awful, (Al 56) also near-by Wine Bars + a Jazz Bar. A 10 Euro Radio taxi ride Inc pick-up charge and tip took us anywhere we wanted to go to from this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A nice little find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first internet booked holiday and we were a little cautious as the price appeared cheap compared with hotels with less stars. We need not have worried. It was a short distance to the centre of Rome but, being built on a piazza in the financial district, we felt safe and it was a very quiet location. We felt that it was a definite advantage being just outside the centre and it was only a couple of minutes walk to a bus stop to the railway terminal/bus station. There was air conditioning and the towels and linen were changed daily. The reception staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was a buffet which consisted of a juices, cheese, ham, yoghurt fresh and tinned fruit, rolls and croissants.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel within walking distance to many of the sites of Rome. Located in the financial district; this is ideal for the business traveler. The downside of this hotel was the rudeness of the front desk staff which tried to create the feeling they were doing us a favor when we arrived.
